{{also|Hoch}} ==Czech== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|cs|[ɦox]}} * {{audio|cs|Cs-hoch.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{cs-noun|g=m-an}} # [[boy]] ====Declension==== {{cs-decl-noun |hoch|hocha|[[hochu]], [[hochovi]]|hocha|hochu|[[hochu]], [[hochovi]]|hochem |hoši|hochů|hochům|hochy|hoši|hoších|hochy }} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|cs|kluk|g=m}} , {{l|cs|chlapec}} {{g|m}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:PSJC}} * {{R:SSJC}} [[Category:cs:Children]] [[Category:cs:Male people]] ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|kewk}} From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|hōh}}, {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*hauhaz}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*kewk-}}, a suffixed form of {{m|ine-pro|*kew-}}. Compare {{cog|nl|hoog}}, {{cog|en|high}}, {{cog|sv|hög}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/hoːx/}} * {{audio|de|De-hoch.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-hoch.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|höher|höchsten}} # [[high]], [[tall]] # [[large]], [[big]], [[heavy]] # [[grand]], [[important]] # {{lb|de|mathematics}} [[to the power of]] #: ''fünf '''hoch''' vier'' #:: five '''to the power of''' four, (5⁴) ====Declension==== Since intervocalic /x/ became /h/ in Old High German, the adjective now has an irregular declension. The predicative form /hoːx/ is spelled ''hoch'' today, while the Old High German spelling for the same pronunciation was {{m|goh|hoh}}, but declined forms still are written ''hoh-'', e.g. ''der hohe Berg'' ("the high mountain"), and pronounced /hoː-/ in most regions and /hoːh-/ in Switzerland. {{de-decl-adj|hoh|höher|höchst}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|groß}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|niedrig}} * {{l|de|nieder}} ====Derived terms==== {{top3}} * {{l|de|Dreikäsehoch}} * {{l|de|Hochachtung}} * {{l|de|hochachtungsvoll}} * {{l|de|Hochadel}} * {{l|de|Hochaltar}} * {{l|de|hochdeutsch}} * {{l|de|hochdienen}} * {{l|de|Hochdruck}} * {{l|de|Hochebene}} {{mid3}} * {{l|de|Hochformat}} * {{l|de|Hochgebirge}} * {{l|de|hochgefährlich}} * {{l|de|Hochmeister}} * {{l|de|Hochmut}} * {{l|de|hochnäsig}} * {{l|de|Hochofen}} * {{l|de|Hochrad}} * {{l|de|Hochschule}} * {{l|de|Hochstapler}} {{mid3}} * {{l|de|hochtrabend}} * {{l|de|Hochverrat}} * {{l|de|Hochwasser}} * {{l|de|Hochwild}} * {{l|de|hochwohlgeboren}} * {{l|de|Hochzeit}} * {{l|de|ranghoch}} * {{l|de|wolkenhoch}} {{bottom}} ====Related terms==== {{top3}} * {{l|de|Anhöhe}} * {{l|de|erhöhen}} {{mid3}} * {{l|de|höchst}} * {{l|de|höchstens}} {{mid3}} * {{l|de|Höhe}} * {{l|de|Hoheit}} {{bottom}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv|höher|höchsten}} # [[up]], [[upwards]] # {{q|colloquial|figurative}} [[northwards]] #: ''Wir fahren hoch an die Küste.'' #:: We'll drive up to the coast.
